sentences.english: Rewards for past good deeds will be yours.
sentences.chinese: 往時的善事會給帶來報答。

sentences.english: In return (for it), I'll show you some picture books.
sentences.chinese: 作爲報答，我將給你看一些畫冊。

sentences.english: You thanked her by throwing it through the next-door-neighbor's window.
sentences.chinese: 你報答她，把鄰居的玻璃砸得稀里嘩啦。

sentences.english: If Buddhism is supporting me, how am I going to repay the Buddha's kindness?
sentences.chinese: 若是佛教護持我，我應如何去報答佛恩？

sentences.english: Some day I will reciprocate your kindness to me.
sentences.chinese: 總有一天我會報答你對我的恩德。

sentences.english: She will be there for you, takin' good care of you.
sentences.chinese: 她會報答你，很好地照顧你。

sentences.english: You thanked her by plopping into the nearest pile of mud.
sentences.chinese: 你報答她，撲通一聲摔進旁邊一堆泥巴里。

sentences.english: It is the reward of our martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 是我們對先烈的報答，對歷史的擔當。

sentences.english: She gave him a pound for his help.
sentences.chinese: 她付給他一英鎊作爲匡助的報答。

sentences.english: I woke up to the time of discovery, but I do not know how to repay.
sentences.chinese: 我醒時方得以發現，卻不知如何報答。

sentences.english: How can I reward your kindness?
sentences.chinese: 我怎麼才能報答你的恩情呢？

sentences.english: What are you doing with all God has given you.
sentences.chinese: 神將百物厚賜給你，你當如何報答神呢？

sentences.english: Is this the return thou makest to the Lord, O foolish and senseless people?
sentences.chinese: 愚昧無知的人民，你們就這樣報答上主嗎？

sentences.english: I'll requite you for your help.
What shall we pay this prophet?
sentences.chinese: 我們如何報答這個先知？

sentences.english: A dog reacts to kindness by wagging its tail .
sentences.chinese: 狗搖尾巴以報答人們的愛護。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to pay a debt of gratitude/to repay a kindness
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
